metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1318 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
Adding method ACLs in remap.config can cause a segfault when the user makes a carefully crafted request. This affects versions Apache Traffic Server (ATS) 6.0.0 to 6.2.2 and 7.0.0 to 7.1.3. To resolve this issue users running 6.x should upgrade to 6.2.3 or later versions and 7.x users should upgrade to 7.1.4 or later versions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-1318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 7.1.4+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 7.1.4+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.1.4+ds-1').
